person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Prison officials said they had no record of Mills ' official conversion , but they said that , on May 14 , 1991 , he had asked that a new name , Yuhanna Abdullah Muhammed , be added to his prison file , which is usually an indication of a conversion to Islam .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| Mills |
| prison officials |

Explanation:

The "Person" entities in the paragraph are "Mills" and "prison officials". "Mills" is explicitly mentioned as a person, while "prison officials" is a group of people who are responsible for managing a prison. Although it is a group and not an individual, it is still considered a valid "Person" entity in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
| --- |
| Mills |

Explanation:

The only valid "Person" entity in the paragraph is "Mills". Although "prison officials" are people, they are not clearly referred to as individuals in this context, but rather as a group of people responsible for managing a prison. Therefore, they do not meet the criteria for being a "Person" entity.
